result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonte D Wrencher

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Devonte D Wrencher not in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing at 8:30am. Case called at 4:50pm.  States witness was present in the morning. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. No action taken on bail.

Defendant Devonte D Wrencher not in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Reed appears as a representative of the State Public Defender's office. The State Public Defender's office has not yet appointed counsel. Defendant's uncle appears in court and makes statement. Court ordered a bench WARRANT issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case is adjourned to preliminary court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devonte D Wrencher in court, appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM022942   Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/28/2022
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders by telephone calls.

Defendant Devonte D Wrencher in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Devonte D Wrencher in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonte D Wrencher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defendant entered a not guilty plea to  misdemeanor Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
